department: Public Works and Government Services Canada
short_summary: The Government of Canada is seeking bids for concrete repair work on behalf of the Department of National Defence. The requirement is for a regional individual standing offer for material, labour, equipment and supervision required for concrete repair around various buildings at 17 Wing Det Dundurn, SK. The period of the Standing Offer will be for three (3) years with the option to extend for two (2) additional one(1) year periods.  The estimated amount is $125,000.00 CAD, per year.  The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.  The requirement is subject to the provisions of the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).
description: The requirement is to establish a Regional Individual Standing Offer for material, labor, equipment and supervision required for concrete repair around various buildings at 17 Wing Det Dundurn, SK. Duration: 3 years + 2 x 1-year extensions. Estimated annual value: $125,000.00 CAD. See Attachments for full details.
full_summary:
### Request for Proposal: Concrete Repair
#### Abstract
The Department of National Defence (DND) is seeking a Regional Indigenous Standing Offer (REOS) contract for concrete repair services at 17 Wing Det Dundurn, Dundurn, SK. The REOS contract will be for a period of three years with an option to extend for two additional one-year periods.

#### Request Background
The Government of Canada invites interested suppliers to submit a proposal for the REOS contract. This procurement falls under the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

#### Requirements
- The contractor will be responsible for providing material, labour, and equipment for concrete repair services.
- The contractor will provide supervision for the duration of the contract.
- The estimated value of the REOS contract is $125,000 CAD per year (GST included).
- The contractor will be responsible for obtaining all necessary permits and regulatory approvals.

#### Bidder Information
- A complete set of bid documents is available on the Government of Canada's   GETS service provider on the Government of Canada website at [www.canadabuys.ca](http://www.canadabuys.ca).
- Suppliers must submit all required documentation in either official language (English or French).
- All bid forms, special instructions, and amendments must be obtained from the official source to ensure a complete package.

#### Evaluation Criteria
The evaluation will be based on the following criteria:
- Technical merit of the proposal
- Price
A panel of experts will assess all proposals received and select the most suitable bid.

#### Important Notes
- This procurement contains mandatory requirements, failure to comply may result in rejection of the bid.
- Industrial security requirements are included in the attached documents.
- The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.

#### Contact Information
For more information, please contact:
Colin Simard, Contract Officer
Telephone: (204) 583-7859
Email: [colin.simard@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca](mailto:colin.simard@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca)
